ratings.question_text: What is your overall assessment of this course?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: Introductory Quantum Mechanics (QM) - you will learn a lot of QM and even some MM (molecular mechanics), increase your intellectual capacity, but also be super-stressed out from the poor course design. You will understand why the teaching instructors emphasize standards and expectations. You will have to create them for yourself to say the least.
Chem 570 will be a struggle. Just try to hang on. Don't stress too much if you are lost, you will not be alone.
Great lecture to study quantum chemistry.
Yes, I highly recommended the course, because one can develop a thorough understanding of quantum theory though this course.
I believe this course is a great introduction to quantum mechanics. I highly suggest having some quantum background before taking this course.

narratives.question_text: How did this course deepen your knowledge of your discipline/profession? To what extent did this course contribute to your dissertation/research?
comments: Quantum mechanics, abstract notions and derivations do not seem unapproachable anymore as the instructor desired. Electronic structure theory does not seem intimidating anymore and I look forward to using it in my research.
It has helped me develop my knowledge substantially
It is indispensable for pchem students because it does not directly rush into experiments. This is very important.
I believe this course will help in future research applications. Professor Batista goes far in-depth into practical applications of quantum mechanics in chemistry.
